Known Usage Locations

Annotation

Summary Statistics

Description

One or more statistical measures that describe the responses to a particular variable and may include one or more standard summaries, e.g., minimum and maximum values, median, mode, etc. The attribute "wgtd" indicates whether the statistics are weighted or not. The "weight" attribute is an IDREF(S) to the weight element(s) in the study description.

The attribute "type" denotes the type of statistics being shown: mean, median, mode, valid cases, invalid cases, minimum, maximum, or standard deviation. If a value of "other" is used here, a value taken from a controlled vocabulary should be put in the "otherType" attribute. This option should only be used when applying a controlled vocabulary to this attribute. Use the complex element controlledVocabUsed to identify the controlled vocabulary to which the selected term belongs. The attribute "access" records the ID values of all elements in the Data Access and Metadata Access section that describe access conditions for this statistic.

Example

<var> <sumStat type="min">0</sumStat> </var> <var> <sumStat type="max">9</sumStat> </var> <var> <sumStat type="median">4</sumStat> </var>
